{{Infobox magazine | image_file = The Palindromist № 1.jpg | image_size = | image_caption = Cover of the Fall 1996 issue (№ 1) | category = [[Recreational linguistics]] | abbreviation = | editor = [[Mark Saltveit]] | publisher = Palindromist Press | country = United States | based = [[Portland, Oregon]]<ref name="pal"/> | firstdate = 1996 | frequency = Irregular | website = [http://palindromist.org/magazine palindromist.org/magazine] | issn = | LCCN = | OCLC = }} '''''The Palindromist''''' is a magazine devoted to [[palindrome]]s, published since 1996. Initially it was published biannually. The frequency switched to irregular.<ref name="pal">{{cite web|title=The Palindromist |url=http://palindromist.org/index.php|work=The Palindromist|accessdate=June 7, 2020}}</ref> It is edited by [[Mark Saltveit]], a [[Portland, Oregon|Portland]]-based stand-up comedian who won the first-ever World Palindrome Championship.<ref name="steinmetz"/><ref name="harvard"/><ref name="matheson2"/>
Each issue of the magazine prints a variety of palindromes in various forms (letter-unit, word-unit, and vertical), covers palindrome-related news, and seeks to accredit writers of famous palindromes.<ref name="guardian" /><ref name="kickshaws"/> The magazine also covers closely related forms of [[wordplay]], including [[calculator word]]s and written [[charades]].<ref name="kickshaws"/>
The magazine organizes the '''SymmyS Awards''', an annual palindrome competition adjudicated by a celebrity panel. Past judges have included [[Will Shortz]], [[MC Paul Barman]], [[Ben Zimmer]], [[David Allen Cress]], [["Weird Al" Yankovic]], [[Demetri Martin]], and [[John Flansburgh]].<ref name="williams"/><ref name="matheson1"/><ref name="steinmetz"/>
